alert.note: Alert for Clay; Richland (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:28AM CST until December 21 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Lincoln IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Little Wabash River below Clay City affecting Richland and Clay Counties. .The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and forecast precipitation. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Wabash River below Clay City. * WHEN...From this evening to late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor flooding begins to wooded areas and agricultural land immediately adjacent to the river. At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flood left bank farmland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CST Saturday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 18.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Little Wabash River Clay City 18.0 17.1 Sat 9 am CST 18.2 18.2 18.1 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to prepare for flooding. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation.
